  • Week 1

Welcome to Creative Practice Essentials

Please begin this module by reviewing the module handbook. You will find additional information such as the weekly schedule, learning methods, and essential resources. Students are responsible for reading the content of this document. For further information, contact your instructor

View module handbook

Module Outline

This assignment will introduce you to workshops focusing on drawing, visual studies, research skills, digital skills, and software knowledge. Within the module, you will explore different approaches to mark-making and visual observation, which are essential research elements for creating visual images. Additional workshops will introduce you to Adobe software and how digital skills can complement traditional art and design knowledge.

By completing this module, you will acquire practical art and design knowledge, enhancing your ability to explore personal ideas and engage in undergraduate studies with increased confidence and creativity. This module serves as an introduction, preparing you for specialized study on the Contemporary Creative Practices Programme (CCP). The teaching exercises will support you in developing a strong foundation in art and design knowledge and practical skills. Furthermore, you will learn to critically approach visual communication and image-making, utilizing both traditional and digital approaches, techniques, and media.

Learning Outcomes

By the end of this module, you will be able to:

.

Conduct research that challenges preconceptions and informs ideas and personal development

.

Explore the characteristics and relevance of a range of different media, techniques and approaches

.

Critically evaluate the potential uses and application of media experiments

.

Apply a range of media and alternative media combinations to create innovative work that communicates a personal response

.

Resolve problems and produce solutions through the considered application of research and theoretical knowledge

Assessments

  • Creative Practice Portfolio : This will demonstrate your independence, creative development, and personal response to each of the teaching activities covered during the 6-week module: (100%25)

Assessment dates

Please note and manage your submission dates, they are important, and you must submit your assessments before the deadline. It is NOT possible to request an extension. The University will NOT send reminders if your submission is late or if you do not submit at all. If there are exceptional circumstances outside your control (for example, serious illness) affecting your ability to submit on time, you can download an Exceptional Circumstances (EC) formLinks to an external site..

Module Leader

.

Module Leader: Nguyen Quang Vinh

Nguyen Quang Vinh

Quang Vinh earned a Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts from the Central Academy of Fine Arts, Beijing, China, and pursued a career as an artist while teaching at Hanoi Architectural University and Hoa Binh University. In 2014, he completed a MA in Fine Art at AKV | St. Joost School of Art and Design in The Netherlands, later lecturing in the Multimedia Communication department at Vietnam Women's Academy. In 2021, he served as an Associate Lecturer in Design Studies at RMIT University before joining BUV. He continues to exhibit his work internationally, including shows in New York, Paris, and The Netherlands.

Contact

Email: vinh.nq@buv.edu.vn

week1.body:
Welcome to week 1

This week we will look at academic integrity. By the end of this lesson you should be able to define academic integrity, identify 5 criteria for evaluating source credibility, and understand what paraphrasing is.

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. prework: Read Part I of the course textbook. Essential features of academic writing

  2. Class 1: Lecture: After introducing ourselves, let's get started with academic integrity. We'll learn about what it is and how to avoid it, including websites to stay away from and what browsers you should use to conduct research.

  3. Class 2: Group workshop

  4. Class 3: Practical activity

  5. Class 4: Wrap up and Quiz

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • Self-check: What is good academic conduct according to Staffordshire University?

  • Read: Find out when to paraphrase and when to summarise

  • Play: Defeat the plagiarism Goblins!

  • PPT: Review this week's lecture ppt

.

Ask questions, view comments, and get follow-up materials on the course noticeboard
